meanings.definition: To marry more than one spouse at a time.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, people polygamized to form large families.
meanings.sent2: He polygamized by taking two wives in accordance with his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The man accidentally polygamized by proposing to two different women on the same day.
meanings.sent4: Her heart polygamized between two suitors, unable to choose just one.
meanings.sent5: The village chief's decision to polygamize caused quite a stir among the community.

meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe polygamized as a way to ensure their lineage continued.
meanings.sent2: They polygamized within the boundaries of their religious customs.
meanings.sent3: The wealthy merchant jokingly polygamized with his collection of rare artifacts.
meanings.sent4: The company's expansion strategy polygamized various business ventures for growth.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity polygamized different art forms to express her emotions.
